reviews.review_msg: I was taught in her first term at SFU. We had multiple short assignments that term, no major papers. My TA graded harder than she did, so I was fortunate that she graded the rest of my work. She is very approachable and knowledgeable, and I would take a course with her again. I really enjoyed her class and think she is a great teacher.

The workload for this class is frankly insane... We were assigned 100+ readings nearly every week(many of which didn't contribute much to the topic), as well as 8 writing assignments. On top of that, lectures were very disorganized and practically never finished. Janice was nice enough but it felt like she didn't really care about helping us learn

RUN! Janice singlehandedly ruined my love for history. Her lectures taught nothing, she assigned hundreds of pages of readings per week and 8 papers! She also regularly encouraged us to not try our best. She is not there to support or teach.

Like the other reviews said, Janice seems pretty new to teaching but she puts a lot of effort into her lectures. Berk was my TA and I felt like he really pushed everyone to participate. On days when I didn't do the readings, yes tutorials were hard but when I did, discussions were fun and he was always encouraging when I participated.

Janice is a lovely lady who is clearly pretty new to teaching, which is evident in her lectures. I have two complaints; she is probably the hardest marker I've encountered at SFU which is unfortunate for a 200 level class. She also assigns way too much reading each week, coupled with 8 papers. Janice is cool tho. My TA Berk made me want to unalive.

Like most of the reviews have said, expect a lot of reading with tough grading. It's kind of unfortunate that she marks so harshly because I would totally take a class with her again otherwise. Maybe if her marking was better I'd reconsider. Janice is a really caring, sweet prof. I also have a bone to pick with Berk - how is this guy even a TA???

Where to even begin? If you have Berk as your TA you might as well just drop the course entirely. If you feel like reading 100+ pages a week this is the class for you. 8 papers in a 200 level course? Why not! I think the class average is like 60% in a 200 level history course lmao. Janice is actually really nice but my god the class genuinely sucks

I am fuelled by a burning hatred for Janice and Berk Metin. Literally the worst prof I've had and her lectures are mandatory, yet useless. I only show up for the participation. The TA Berk never responds to emails and will tell you to email him for office hours. Their feedback was harsh and blatantly wrong. Will also accuse you of plagiarism lol gg

Janice is super sweet and you can tell she cares a lot about her students as she tries to make lectures fun and interactive. Around 60 - 90 pages of reading each week along with reading reflections and writing assignments that can often make the class feel non-stop, so not a great class if you're not a history major.

I am never taking her classes again. She is such a hard marker. For assignments, simply meeting her requirements is not enough to have a good score. You have to exceed the requirements just to get a decent mark. Also HEAVY on the heavy reading, there is literally SO MUCH to read for each week. if you take this course make sure your course is light.

I made an account just to talk about this class. Janice is nice, however, the class was a bit frustrating. Initially, there was no feedback besides a slightly vague rubric, but she has since changed this. There are lots of readings and papers, so as a slow reader, it was a bit difficult for me, but if you are fast it's probably fine.

I found Professor Jeong to be very personable and her feedback is always thoughtful. Focused on personal accounts of the history moreso than broad narratives. Lecture attendance is done through weekly inclass writing assignments that are typically a few sentence reflections. Plenty of reading per week but definitely manageable!

Janice is very nice, however her class is run horribly and might be the worst university classes I've ever taken. Lectures are absolutely 0 help and extremely disorganized, but attendance is mandatory and worth a large portion of your mark. 8 papers in a 200 level course. An insane amount of reading per week, often over 100 pages.

Don't take this class. We were the professor's "guinea pigs" as it was her first time teaching. That obviously means that this level 200 course should have 8 papers and 100+ pages of reading per week right? I've never had more passion for a professor than Janice, and it's a passion of hate

Amazing lectures - but 90% of the class were econ or commerce students who could barely speak English - Green's incredible lectures on Chinese history were wasted on them (when they even bothered to show up). He made the assignments easy, cut back on the reading, and spoon-fed them the answers and they still complained.  Great Prof!

The best prof i have so far, even though Colin is a part-time prof at SFU. His huge interest in China makes him passionate about the topic he is teaching. Exams are fair and creative thinking is highly encouraged. Take his class! Whether for requirement or elective!

I was a student of HIST 255. Honestly, I was a student of 255. I saw someone comment that Dr. Brown is an emotional professor while he is giving a lecture. I do not agree with that and I think 90% of Hist 255 students do not believe that! Also, I believe these "unbelievable" comments are from "one single person".
Fantastic
Dr. Brown is a great professor! I highly recommend taking this class with him! He is one of the best professors in the SFU History Department!
Professor Brown is an absolute gem! His lectures were very interesting and well organized. Highly reccomend taking this class.
Good to take if you need to boost your GPA. TA is knowledgeable and nice though.
His emotions are out of control when he  is giving lectures.
This Prof needs some professional help. Hope that SFU can host some emotion management and communication skill workshops for Prof. Brown.

Jeremy is the GOAT by far. He really makes the lecture content interesting. All opinions are respected and he engages with the class. Honestly the most laid back lecture I have ever been in. He doesn't expect you to memorize dates. Instead he tries to get you to understand what life was like for the people living in the time period. Must take prof

A very good professor, love talking with students in his office hour. Hard working is very necessary. Do not skip his class until you finish all of your quiz, he will not tell you which class he will test your quiz. Please read the books he show you or you can not have a good mark.
Good professor and teacher assistance. The grading is fair for everyone either Chinese and non Chinese.
really talented professor, Profound knowledge, interesting lecture.

There was this one time when I was late for his lecture, and I found myself standing outside the door and spent 3 min contemplating if i should go in or not. But he's a good prof and his tas are awesome.

Awesome professor but kind of intimidating... really scary if you're late or chatting in class. He memorizes the names and faces of all his students so don't think you can get away with it! Don't play on your laptops or cellphones, he can tell! Overall great professor, would take another class with him.

Great prof. He really knows how to convey his material. Makes dry history interesting, and stays away from stereotypical judgements. DON'T be late to class. He hates it. He has his rules, and his way of teaching class. Which I think is completely understandable.
Took HIST 255 and taking 479. He excepts hard work from his students. No more, no less. Punctual, clear, and helpful.

Fantastic professor! Dr. Brown is extremely knowledgeable and passionate in his field, and is able to convey material in a combined serious/funny lecture style making it enjoyable and informative. One of the best professors I've had at SFU to date! (Both 254 and 255 are excellent courses).
Fabulous course, fantastic professor. Thought this would be my only Chinese history class and discovered that it definitely won't be.
if you go to class and tutorial, you will be fine. Great professor forever.

Great prof and loved his lectures! He does not baby students with overly detailed power points and it's up to them to come to class.  Sometimes the TAs used a set of different criteria than Prof Brown.

I've also taken hist254 and 255 with Dr.Brown. He is a great lecturer who is passionate about his subjects. He is very clear on what he expects of students. He will try to remember everyone's name because he wants to show you the respect that he wants from you! He brings the facts and his own point of view to make lectures very interesting.

I had Prof Brown for both HIST 254 and 255. He is amazing! Very interesting lectures. Loved his classes. There is a lot of reading, but very manageable. Highly recommended even if you're not a history major such as myself.
GREAT PROF!!!
best prof ever for HIST 255- History of China since the 1800s

I actually took 254 and 255 with Dr. Brown. His lectures are very organized and to the point (very captivating, as well). He has very clear expectations (i.e. don't be late; attend lecture; do the readings), and if you follow his guidelines, it's a joyride. All in all, a very approachable and caring professor. Definitely take courses with him!
very good prof! extremely interesting and nice!! definitely take his class if you get a chance
Very nice and open-minded personality.  Had her for hist255.  I would definitely take her again.
